article.paragraph: Analcimeoranalcite(from theGreek languageGreekanalkimos- "weak") is a white, grey, or colourlessSilicate mineralstectosilicatemineral. Analcime consists of hydratedsodiumaluminiumsilicatein cubiccrystallineform. Itschemical formulaissodiumNaaluminiumAlsiliconSi2oxygenO6water (molecule)H2O. Minor amounts ofpotassiumandcalciumsubstitute for sodium. Asilver-bearing synthetic variety also exists (Ag-analcite).

Analcime is usually classified as azeolitemineral, but structurally and chemically it is more similar to thefeldspathoids. Analcime occurs as a primary mineral in analcimebasaltand other alkalineigneous rocks. It also occurs as cavity and vesicle fillings associated withprehnite,calcite, and zeolites.
